dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, you know, the Trump family, they've always been about, um, this incredible drive, right? From Friedrich to the Klondike, all the way to Donald and the White House.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, you know, the Trump family, they've always been about, um, this incredible drive, right? From Friedrich to the Klondike, all the way to Donald and the White House.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are what nudged Donald Trumps grandfather Friedrich from Germany to New York to the Klondike gold rush; impelled the presidents father, Fred, to build an apartment empire in Brooklyn and Queens; and pushed Donald into Manhattan skyscrapers and, eventually, the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's this relentless ambition. And when Donald took office, his sons, Eric and Don Jr., they certainly had their own grand plans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's this relentless ambition. And when Donald took office, his sons, Eric and Don Junior, they certainly had their own grand plans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When Trump took office and passed the reins to the fourth generation, his sons Eric and Don Jr. had grand ambitions too.

dialogue_turns.text: Totally. They wanted to, like, storm America's heartland with these two new licensed restaurant brands.

That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.

dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, that forced them into a very... un-Trumpian strategy. Not about building, but, um, selling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, that forced them into a very... un-Trumpian strategy. Not about building, but, um, selling.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy... Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdings...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, selling off assets. And some of these sales, they're a bit eyebrow-raising, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, selling off assets. And some of these sales, they're a bit eyebrow-raising, wouldn't you say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. The Dominican Republic land sale, for example. That was, uh, a pretty clear violation of the pledge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. The Dominican Republic land sale, for example. That was, uh, a pretty clear violation of the pledge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And then you have the Beverly Hills mansion sale, linked to a Russian oligarch. And the Manhattan penthouse to someone selling access to Australian officials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And then you have the Beverly Hills mansion sale, linked to a Russian oligarch. And the Manhattan penthouse to someone selling access to Australian officials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They sold Trumps mansion in Beverly Hills for $13.5 million to a company tied to Indonesian billionaire (and Trump business partner) Hary Tanoesoedibjo. They off-loaded a Manhattan penthouse to a woman who runs a business selling access to Chinese officials.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It just, um, looks bad. And what about the Spring Creek Towers deal? Ben Carson, HUD Secretary, approving a sale that put twenty million in his boss's pocket?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It just, um, looks bad. And what about the Spring Creek Towers deal? Ben Carson, H U D Secretary, approving a sale that put twenty million in his boss's pocket?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That put Trumps subordinate in the awkward position of having to green-light a transaction that paid his boss an estimated $33 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Super awkward, right? So, they're selling all this, but they're not really reinvesting in new projects, are they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Super awkward, right? So, they're selling all this, but they're not really reinvesting in new projects, are they?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For all this selling, the Trumps have done very little reinvesting. Trump Tower got minor updates, a five-story San Francisco office building got a face-lift and the Trumps keep stuffing cash into their money-losing European golf resorts. But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, not in the traditional Trump way, no. Minor updates here and there, a condo from their aunt in Mar-a-Lago, but mostly it's been about paying down debt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, not in the traditional Trump way, no. Minor updates here and there, a condo from their aunt in Mar-a-Lago, but mostly it's been about paying down debt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump Tower got minor updates... But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry... Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, millions at 40 Wall Street, San Francisco, even a Las Vegas tower loan. They're, like, hunkering down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, millions at forty Wall Street, San Francisco, even a Las Vegas tower loan. They're, like, hunkering down.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In New York, they wiped out roughly $19 million of liabilities at 40 Wall Street, 6 East 57th Street and 502 Park Avenue. In San Francisco, where the president owns 30% of a skyscraper alongside billionaire Steven Roths Vornado Realty Trust, Trumps kids have erased $8 million of his debt. In late 2016, Trump took out a $30 million loan against a Las Vegas tower he owns with fellow billionaire Phil Ruffin... After selling dozens of condos in the building, the Trumps repaid that loan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, a very conservative play for the Trump kids right now. Stockpiling cash, reducing liabilities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, a very conservative play for the Trump kids right now. Stockpiling cash, reducing liabilities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Don Jr. and Eric are playing things conservatively, tending to their properties, paying down debt and stockpiling a hoard of cash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, um, a huge shift from the 'build bigger, build bolder' philosophy we associate with the Trump name.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, um, a huge shift from the build bigger, build bolder philosophy we associate with the Trump name.

dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's a quiet period for them, financially speaking, while dad's in the White House.
